private_information: The left peg currently has disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Disks are labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
left_agent.goal: Support moving the stack so that ultimately the right peg has all disks in order.

private_information: The middle peg is currently empty.
middle_agent.goal: Support intermediate moves according to the Hanoi rules.

private_information: The right peg is currently empty.
right_agent.goal: Receive the full stack of disks in correct order.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and produce the final planning specification for an automated solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance moving all disks from left to right following the rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A through H with A the smallest and H the largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Middle peg empty. Right peg empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Left and middle pegs empty.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the local peg state you control including the ordered list of disks from top to bottom and any local constraints or invariants.
report_state.prompt: Your name is left_agent. Using your private information and the public information in the environment, produce a structured description of the left peg state suitable for consumption by a central planner. Do not produce PDDL.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the local peg state you control including the ordered list of disks from top to bottom and any local constraints or invariants.
report_state.prompt: Your name is middle_agent. Using your private information and the public information in the environment, produce a structured description of the middle peg state suitable for consumption by a central planner. Do not produce PDDL.

report_state.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the local peg state you control including the ordered list of disks from top to bottom and any local constraints or invariants.
report_state.prompt: Your name is right_agent. Using your private information and the public information in the environment, produce a structured description of the right peg state suitable for consumption by a central planner. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your task is to assemble the received peg state descriptions and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance using the FastDownwards planner. The PDDL should be compatible with FastDownwards (use a standard STRIPS formulation or PDDL features supported by FastDownwards). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions represent single-disk moves between pegs and enforce the rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller one.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive structured state descriptions from the three peg agents. Integrate these inputs and emit a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that accomplishes moving the full stack from left to right while respecting Hanoi rules. The domain and problem must be ready to run with FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
